content: A train travels at an average speed of 60 miles per hour. How long will it take the train to travel a distance of 450 miles?

To find out how long it will take the train to travel 450 miles at an average speed of 60 miles per hour, we can use the formula for time, which is:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{\text{distance}}{\text{speed}} \]

Plugging in the given values:

\[ \text{time} = \frac{450 \text{ miles}}{60 \text{ miles per hour}} \]

Now, performing the division:

\[ \text{time} = 7.5 \text{ hours} \]

So, it will take the train 7.5 hours to travel 450 miles at an average speed of 60 miles per hour.
